ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:0.5_0: The training rule on going to the instruction
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.2_0: At that time the nuns did not enquire about the observance day nor ask for the instruction.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.3_0: The monks complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.4_0: “How can the nuns not do this?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.5_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nuns don’t do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.8_0: “... How can the nuns not do this?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.9_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.10_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1_0: ‘Every half-month a nun should seek two things from the Sangha of monks: asking it about the observance day and going to it for the instruction.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:1.11.1_1: If she goes beyond that, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.4_0: there are two observance days: the fourteenth and the fifteenth.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.7_0: If she thinks, “I won’t ask for the instruction,” and she requests her to give her the mere fact of giving up her duty, she commits an offense entailing confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.8.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.10_0: if she searches for a companion nun, but does not find one;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.14_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-pc59:2.15_0: The ninth training rule is finished.
